alert.note: Alert for Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:47AM EST until January 10 at 9:22AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Goose Creek near Leesburg affecting Loudoun County. For the Goose Creek...including Leesburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Goose Creek near Leesburg. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The creek overflows its banks near Oatlands, south of Leesburg. Backwater flooding begins to affect a low spot on State Route 650, Oatlands Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.9 feet, or 0.1 feet below flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 11.8 feet early this morning. It will then rise above flood stage early this morning to 12.2 feet this morning. It will fall below flood stage this morning to 2.7 feet early Friday afternoon then rise again. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.3 feet on 11/13/1970. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7AM 1PM 7PM Stg Time Date Goose Creek Leesburg 12.0 11.9 Wed 1 am 12.2 8.7 4.8 12.2 7am Wed &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this morning at 930 AM EST.
